definition: weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.english: Ill health seems to have cleared Sarah out.
sentences.chinese: 看来体弱多病已经把萨拉弄得不名一文。

sentences.english: But emesis is prohibited for pregnant women and must be applied cautiously to the weak.
sentences.chinese: 但是吐法禁用于妊娠妇女，慎用于体弱者。

sentences.english: Enema for constipation in children and the treatment of the elderly and infirm.
sentences.chinese: 开塞露用于小儿及年老体弱者便秘的治疗。

sentences.english: As the angel grows up, her parents grow old and weak.
sentences.chinese: 小天使日渐长大，她的父母也变得年迈体弱起来。

sentences.english: Help the old and the weak when go upstairs or downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 当上下楼梯时，帮助年老体弱者。

sentences.english: He doesn't work as quickly as he used to because of his old age.
sentences.chinese: 由于年老体弱，他不像原来工作得那样快了。

sentences.english: Father was too weak to support the family and the son was dragooned into stealing again.
sentences.chinese: 父亲体弱无力养家糊口，儿子又被迫行窃。

sentences.english: Infirmity suitable long sleeve shirt and pants.
sentences.chinese: 年老体弱者宜着长袖衬衫和单裤。

sentences.english: She strikes a pose of being an invalid when really she is well and strong.
sentences.chinese: 她装出一副有病体弱的样子，但实际上身体强壮。

sentences.english: The old and weak people easily catch the flu.
sentences.chinese: 年老体弱的人容易患流感。

sentences.english: Use care if the body is weak.
But a nephew of the sickly leader is also a nominee.
sentences.chinese: 但一个领导人的体弱多病的侄子也被提名。

sentences.english: We were sick, but now our blood pressures have gone down," a member said.
sentences.chinese: 我们以前都体弱多病，现在血压都降低了。

sentences.english: What could a weak old man dobut yield?
sentences.chinese: 一个年老体弱的人，除了屈服，还能怎样？

sentences.english: Thouht of the thin body, grandma undertakes all the housework.
sentences.chinese: 虽然祖母体弱多病，她却承担起了家里的所有家务。

sentences.english: I saw him young and strong, and now he is old and worn .
sentences.chinese: 我看到他的时候，他年轻强壮，现在他已年老体弱。

definition: unable to move freely/difficult to get about
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
a person who is in poor health cannot handle sth so strong as a tonic
old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
